intro: Nautilocalyx lacteus, commonly known as the milkwood tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree has smooth, grey bark and produces small, round fruits that contain a milky sap, giving it its common name. It is often found in coastal and riverine forests, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant is valued for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local communities.
